chapters.summary: Taste the Mediterranean now at Whole Foods Market. Apple Card is the perfect cashback rewards credit card. A Proposition 65 warning label can expose you to chemicals known to the state of California to cause cancer and birth defects. To trace the origin of these poorly designed warnings, talk to David Rowe.
chapters.gist: Taste the Mediterranean at Whole Foods Market
chapters.headline: Vivian Ley explores the origins of California Proposition 65 warning labels

chapters.summary: The new warning signs are the result of a 1986 ballot initiative, Proposition 65. Actress Jane Fonda and her husband were co founders of the Campaign for Economic Democracy. Armed with impressive celebrity endorsements and a clear environmental message, Prop 65 passed in a landslide victory.
chapters.headline: Proposition 65, California's landmark environmental measure, passed overwhelmingly in 1986

chapters.summary: There are over 1000 chemicals on the Proposition 65 list. For some businesses, especially smaller ones, it can be difficult and expensive to test for all 1000 chemicals. Study: Prop 65 lawsuits were costing California businesses around $30 million a year. How can a small business navigate that law?
chapters.gist: Proposition 65 Bounty Hunters: How to navigate the law
chapters.headline: Proposition 65 has been a powerful tool for environmentalists but it's also incentivized lawsuits

chapters.summary: The federal definition of lead free was eventually lowered from 8% to zero point 25%. But that change didn't take place until 2011, when companies remove dangerous chemicals to meet prop 65 guidelines. Because the state of California has the fifth biggest economy in the world, producers globally are pushed to do the same.
chapters.gist: Prop 65 and the lead in California products
chapters.headline: California companies remove dangerous chemicals to meet prop 65 guidelines

chapters.summary: If they could change anything about Prop 65, what would it be? Tod Cooperman would want the warning labels themselves to be more helpful to consumers. How can the federal government do more to protect us so that we don't need Prop 65 anymore?
chapters.gist: If They Could Change Prop 65, What Would It Be?
chapters.headline: If they could change anything about Prop 65, what would it be

chapters.summary: In 1979, there was a partial core meltdown at the three Mile island nuclear power plant near Harrisburg, Pennsylvania. Professor Judy Edworthy studies psychoacoustics and alarm design. She says humans are bombarded by so many alarms in our everyday life that we just start tuning them out. Alarm design really matters.
